p: It has been stated that the outer membrane of microorganisms was disintegrated by thymol, and therefore the permeability of the cytoplasmic membrane increased and release of K+ and ATP was carried out ( 92, 93). Furthermore, its integration with the polar head-group placed in the lipid bilayer leads to cell membrane alteration ( 94). It has been also noted that the citrate metabolic pathway and the enzymes involved in ATP synthesis would be affected by thymol ( 95).
